meanings.sent1: She ran averagely in the race, not too fast or too slow.
meanings.sent2: He sings averagely, not exceptionally well but not poorly either.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed averagely, neither wowing the audience nor disappointing them.
meanings.sent4: The car moved averagely through the traffic, blending in with the other vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The student scored averagely on the test, right in the middle of the class.

meanings.definition: To calculate the average of a set of numbers.
meanings.sent1: She averagely calculated the scores of her classmates for the project.
meanings.sent2: He averagely computed the total sales for the month.
meanings.sent3: The accountant averagely averaged the expenses for the quarterly report.
meanings.sent4: The teacher averagely averaged the grades of the students for the semester.
meanings.sent5: The scientist averagely averaged the data points for the research study.

meanings.sent1: It was an averagely warm day for this time of year.
meanings.sent2: She had an averagely busy schedule, with a few meetings and some free time.
meanings.sent3: The cake was averagely delicious, nothing extraordinary but still enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: He lived in an averagely sized house in the suburbs.
meanings.sent5: The movie was averagely entertaining, not a blockbuster but not a flop either.
